There are a lot of cops around.
There's a lot but it's hard to get information on them.
Sometimes a choir sings in the library. The song echos and it sounds pretty cool.
Cost per unit went up $10.00 this semester and books cost me over $200.00. Good compared to a private University but very expense for community college.
Visit the library. It's a nice place to read and find out more about what is going on around campus.
It is a off campus school. the area which it is located is not too pleasing.
Although my grades have not been the best, this school lacks in pushing its students to thrive and some professors and very unorganized and hard to understand.
Use ratemyprofessor.com, it is very useful in finding the right fit for you. Some professors here aren't at the caliber they should be.
I like this school quite a bit. The students are diverse and welcoming. However, they are painfully short-handed on staff and qualified professors.
pageTitle: San Diego Mesa College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {335957=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 10239=As far as community colleges in the greater San Diego area go, San Diego Mesa College is by far one of the better ones to attend. The range from the choice of classes to quality of professors, Mesa has much more to offer than any of the other San Diego District Community Colleges (which include Miramar, Mesa, and City). I would know, I've attended all three. Mesa even supersedes the other districts such as Grossmont and Southwestern. Even through the budget cuts and all the financial decreases in the past year, Mesa seems to be upholding their standards of actually giving a decent education, as best as it gets for community that is., 4974=Its community college, if you do not want to spend the high cost of what a 4 year college and private colleges make you pay stick with a community college. Mesa is a part of the San Diego Community Colleges (City and Miramar are the other two). At the time of this post $26 per credit for local CA residents is a great deal to get your GE done and go for an AA and then transfer to a 4 year.}

textAfterTable: Am learning a lot I currently took C++ and C# programming classes from Mesa online, and I did learn a lot about programming and how bad I am at programming. But at the same time the teachers and students were helpful throughout the class. Login to rate or flag the reviews Paulina from San Diego, CA 08/28/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 1 out of 1 people found this review useful. 3 of 83 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Good college for students who want to stay focused to transfer, or to get their life back on track and go back to school. Overall a good foundation for anyone trying to either get on or stay on an educated track. Tips for prospective students Campus can be a bit confusing, but for the most part it's packed tight together once you get familiar with it.
